content:
Posted: December 2, 2015
												Path of exile is as some would say, the true successor to Diablo 2. While in reality thats not a fair comparrison as they are two very different games.Path of exile is a refreshing take on a very common genre.::Pros::HUGE Passive treeLittle to no Gear limitationsLarge RNG factorDecent graphicsGGG Updates often mixing the meta up.::Cons::Trading system ( will explain below )Support ( will explain below )Forums ( Will explain below )No end-game contentNo real reason to level past 78Flooded Economy (Will explain below )==========The Pros Explanation============--Huge passive tree-- Huge doesnt really do it justice. and Currently ( pre ascendency patch ) you have fully open class choice allowing for pretty sweet combinations of classes, Tanky casters, Squishy meat shields. etc etc. You name it, you can do it.  Note- This is said to change after ascendency is dropped. They will be adding 'Sub Class' which will extremely hamper your ability to make fun and interesting builds and will churn out cookie cutter builds. If you want to have an effective X-Skill, you have to play the class that has access to X-Subclass. IMO ruining a HUGE portion of this games uniqueness.--Gear Limitations -- Gear is purely based on STR/Dex/INT and Level. no specific class restrictions.--Large RNG-- Meaning X Weapon isnt the best because it can rolled badly or be completely missing stats. Making the game have nice replayability.--Graphics --  THey're pretty good, little dated. but they update it occasionally--GGG Mixup-- They change stats vastly, So what works today, maynot work tomorrow. which some people hate. but every day is a gamble.==========THE CONS EXPLANATION=========-- Trading system -- So, the trading system. The Trading system is how the old school gaming trades use to take place. Meet up face to face, you throw your item in, they throw thier item in and you both hit accept and the trade is done. Yay!, Now where is the problem you ask? Its the process of FINDING that buyer or FINDING that seller. You have a few Options. 1), use Trade chat : 2), Use a Thirdparty websiteDue to the limitations of trade chat ( being very little ),  there are piles of bots that sit there and spam trade chat making it scroll faster then the wheels on a slot machine. Making finding a specific piece of gear nearly impossible.Using a third party website is the best possible alternative. which creates a rough 'Item Search' if you know exactly what it is you need. which is usually priced 20 or 30% over in-game value.(side rant), If you DO by the graces of god find someone selling the item you need in Trade chat. When you ask how much he wants for it, he will respond with " Offer ". There is NO right answer to respond to this. If you offer the appropriate value, He will haggle you or insult you for whatever reason. If you undercut him, he will get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off, tell you " NOOB THIS IS WORTH (X) " very clearly telling you he knew what he wants for his item and is waiting for someone to Overpay and rip them off.-- Support --Support for this game is just as bad as dealing with the @$$hole trying to price his crap. If your account is stolen, Tough luck, they dont care and will not assist you in any way.  If your account is hacked and all ur stuff is gone? Too bad, They will send you a link on how they think you can do better at not getting your account stolen.  Did your Hardcore Charecter die because thier servers all of a suddon crashed?   Oh well your ♥♥♥♥ed, under no circumstances will they reinstate them even if the fault is accepted by GGG's staff.-- Forums --The forum Mods will move our thread as they see fit, For whatever reason they decide to get thier jollies for. And if you inquire as to the move or request it to be adjusted, you will either get banned from the forums, Muted for a period of time or threatened with account deletion for questioning a mod. There is No set rules for Muting or Banning in this game. If they feel like they dont like what you said. Banned/Muted. If the aforementioned trade guy verbally assaults you and you respond with " Jesus calm down " and he reports you for harrasment ( right click, Report - is all it takes ) You will be muted for a fairly random length of time, ranging from a minute to days. Saying any keywords no matter the context, Such as "Hitler" even in a line as " Hitler did terrible things " will result in a ban if someone so much as hits the report button. (Side rant) If you are trying to sell an item and the Trade Chat is going to fast, simply right click and submit for 'Spam' on each person that tries to list thier items. They will drop like flys and you can post your stuff. Untill your muted too that is.---End game content --They sort-of recently added thier attempt at end-game content which consists of a few bossfights. While the fight itself is ok and sorta appealing, The items that are needed to access this content are very rare, and due to the rarity, are expensive to purchase from other players. Meaning you can do maybe 1 or 2 runs a day, If you have the money to buy them. Or, you have to find the items yourself which is a extremely rare drop, from a rare random spawn location within a map. Ive personally found 2 of these items in the 300 Hours ive played since they were released. One of which i just found today. So what do you do for end-game content between those? You grind your face against maps that are WAY under ur level getting♥♥♥♥♥♥experience hoping for currency drops to pile up to eventually be able to do that content again, that will take you 20 minutes to complete. to then farm again for a day or two.-- Leveling past 80 -- No gear is past lvl 75 i believe currently, So leveling past that is merely for personal pleasure or a few passive points which isnt worth the mind numbing ♥♥♥♥♥♥ exp wall.-- Flooded Economy -- The game has many leagues/seasons/races/etc etc that all lead into standard, these leagues offer increased drop rates or spawn rates which vastly increases loot, which all get sshuffled into the already increased economy, Everything is stupid expensive, currency value is garbage.TLDR: Fun game to pass time a while, dont invest too much and dont cause urself to need support. Good game, 7/10, But wont reccomend it in its current state.

number of helpful: 31 of 60 people (52%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												When you start playing, the game seems nicely made, and lot of nice ideas and discovering are there, but it wont last...- They limited the tabs to 4, knowing that people who get involved on this game will quickly need more.Just look at the transaction store, the most popular buys are extra tabs. People are not 'supporting' the game, they are forced to buy more tabs to play without being constantly annoyed by the limited space of storage.So, the game is free for who don't care about the game, the others will have to drop the money,And do not expect nice prices, everything on the store is overpriced. Want 6 more basic tabs ? +-14€Want a cosmetic skin that looks cool? Don't be surprised if most of them costs like 20€...- Remember the bumblegums that were containing stickers to collect? The makers were making one of the sticker extremely rare to find, on purpose, to push kids to buy more and more bubblegum, wasting their money, until they gave up since the missing sticker was almost never found.The authors of this game are doing the same BS here, all items SEEMS to drop randomly, but there are some internal rules that will make some drop EXTREMELY RARE, making the game frustrating and never ending quest to the desired item. Some items are so rare that they totally lost the purpose of being there...Some little examples:* There are items that are so ridiculously rare, that you will never dare to use them (exalted orb for instance, I found ONLY 1 after 350h)* After 350 hours of game, I NEVER  find any 5 linked socket item, and ofc 6 linked remains an unreasonable dream. And if you want to link 5 or 6 sockets. Good luck, you will need it (and a LOT of orb of fusings, which are also extremely rare to find) One way to make this easier, is to farm... farm and farm forever (you can trade to some merchants). Once you got what you wanted, after thousand of hours playing this, will it worth keep playing even more? That is the worst aspect of this game. You may eventually the stuff you need only once all the battles are behind... Seriously...* (trying to not spoil here) you will need 4 items to collect to activate it (Sacrifice of X), but the 4th part is extremely rare compared the others, which means you will have to play a lot to find it (I never found it myself)- The difficulty: I ended the game after dying like 300x at the boss of act4 Merciless. My little witch with her 1500hp and her commons and spectres could not do anything, and it took ages to kill the guy (1M hp or what ??)Maybe they expect the game to be played for years by people, but for the first run, the game feels just dumb and the difficulty badly set (walk in the park the whole game, rarely dying, even getting boring, since its just basing hack  nslash, then suddently bosses from Apocalypse that can kill you in 1 hit...)- Read popular negative reviews for more details. No need here to repeat other cons here.I could write more, but got enough of this game. After 350 hours, still dont get the point of the game. Maybe its just not for me...- Maybe ill return and will keep playing again some other year, since the game does not have really an ending. But too much BS for now.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2015
												The only game i know with no pay to win at all. The first playthrough is very rough and a rewarding challenge. Every three months there is a hard reset with a free mini expansion in form of a new league where everyone starts with nothing. After the 3 months all items and characters get transfered to the standard realm, which is permanent. We also get almost instant reply on support tickets, they work 24/7 and are always friendly. Its the only game which cares about their players and dont focus on making money. They even interact with them on for example Reddit.You can play a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of builds not like in diablo 3 where each class has one top build which is the only one u can play. Its hard to get into the game and to understand everything since its kinda complex but its completely worth it, I think i can say this after more then 3.000 hours played and still enjoying it like at day one :D Its almost like getting a free addon every 3 months and free big expansion every 6 months to 1year in form of an actual expansion. In games like d3 you need to pay for additional things like this.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2013
												I immediately fell on love with this game! I'll break it down into pros and cons. But the cons really aren't enough to make it not worth playing.==PROS==- First off, it's FREE! And the things in game you do pay for are all aesthetic. So there is no Pay-to-win here.- LOOT!! Loads of loot that is satisfying to find- It looks fantastic! Lot's of gore too- The passive skill tree is amazing- Heaps of nostalgic feelings. If you loved Diablo 2, then play this!- The new potion system is somewhere between classic potions and health globes. But the ability to find "magic" potions makes it fantastic- Skill gems are weird, but it's grown on me- The corpses of monsters staying piled up is gruesome and satisfying==CONS=- Some of the animations are funky. Running looks odd. And there isn't always a lot of oomph to attacking- Can sometimes be lag, where hit's take a second to register (not often though)- I like the removal of gold, but sometimes the bartering system can be super annoying- I wish there were more acheivements. They seem too few and far between

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2014
												This is hands down the best Jew/Trading simulator out there. Definitely beats Recettear by a long shot. What makes it different from other Jew/Trading simulators out there is how there's no in-game money. Everything is valued in orbs, and the focus of the game is to get as many Chaos and Exalted Orbs as possible within a 4-month league. Sure, you can simply say, "but in that case, gold is basically chaos!" and you wouldn't be too far off. However, the items you trade in-game have no fixed value, can be negotiated for fractions of a Chaos/Exalt(which exist as other currencies), are negotiated by the players. Oh yeah, did I mention you trade with other players? That also makes it vastly different from Recettear.It's kind of hard to explain the nature of this game, you just have to trade to figure it out. 90% of unique items are valued at 1 chaos, which is pretty much as low as you'll want to go. Different currencies are available to split Chaos and Exalts, but pretty much do not have a set value themselves, aside from 8 Chance = 2 Scouring = 1 Regret and 8 Alteration = 4 Jeweler's = 1 Fusing. Again, the point of the game is to convert these currencies to Chaos, and eventually Exalts. Pro-tip: Convert your Exalts to Chaos within the first 2 months of a league, then buy Exalts within the last month/last 2 weeks.The Jew/Trading Simulator involves an ARPG minigame, but its not really worth noting compared to the depth of the Trading game. It's basically mind-numbing, "attach main attack/spell skill to a button, attach debuff(curse) to another button, spam both buttons" gameplay. This is due to the fact that BiS items such as Kaom's Heart and Bringer of Rain effectively drop the amount of usable skills by 1. Not only that, but gemslots and links also severely limit your amount of effective usable skills. Focusing on 1 skill is mandatory if you want effective DPS. The ARPG minigame gameplay focuses mostly on passive effects, so its not really that great. The drop rates for gaining items are terrible, so to succeed in this game, you buy good items at really low prices from players desperate to beat the gearchecks of the ARPG minigame, and you sell them for as high as people are willing to buy them.tl;dr 9.5/10, definitely worth your time. Best Jew/Trading simulator of all time.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												Are you crazy about ARPGs? Did you spend counteless hours playing Diablo 1 and 2? have you tried any other ARPG out there just to find that one that hits the spot just like Diablo did? If the answers to those questions is yes, then you have found your game.Called, by many people, the true Diablo 3, although I have not played the 3rd, from what I have seen I tend to agree with those people.So what is it about? Same as any other ARPG, kill♥♥♥♥♥♥and get loot. But unlike the other ones this one has a few twists. Features: 7 character "classes", and I use quotation marks because the classes are only defined by their starting point on the huge passive skill "tree". which brings us to our nest part, the huge♥♥♥♥♥Skill "Tree", or web, or galaxy, whatever it is it is not a tree >.>. The "Skildrassil" as it is often called, consists of a thousand and something (can't remember the exact number) passives, ALL PASSIVES.Active skills in form of socketable gems. You basically take a skill you like and put it in your equipment, with the ability to add supports to it moddifying it according to your taste.Hard♥♥♥♥♥game, yes this is a feature. Hard, somewhat difficult to learn, and extremely hard to master. And this is where most peiople that play it find the appeal.And it's FREE TO PLAY. Only cosmetic MTX available. Best F2P model you'll ever encounter. The game is soo good you'll want to pay, not feel forced to do it, you'll be the devs to take your money.And finally the "bad parts". Desync, yeah it sucks at times, although I haven't had major problems with it. Also some people hate that it's too RNG focused, but I think it's needed for replayability. And it's too damn hard at times, some people find that as a minus.In conclusion, if this review has piqued your interest, and you're a fan of ARPGs, you have no excuse of not playing this one. It's FREE anyway so might as well try it.Update: 10/10Update 2: 2000 hours after; would sell kidney for more.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												This game is excellent. I've played a lot of free-to-play titles, and none have felt as polished as this one. There are a lot of games backed by pretty large companies (Especially the "B" word of gaming) that fail to accomplish what this indie gem has made short work of. The skill tree is fresh and very interesting to tinker with, and the game itself looks pretty beautiful. There were a couple times when me and my buddy who I'm playing the game through with have literally stopped to take in the scenery. That's an accomplishment and a half on games os this genre, which emphasize gameplay over graphics in most situations. The level design just seems believable. The only downside of the game is that the economy is very difficult for new players to grasp. You don't have a normal form of currency, instead, you use various crafting orbs to barter. The exchange rates are definitely going to confuse newcomers, but you'll get used to it and you may even like the new take on trade.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												I've played POE for a few years on and off.  It is a fine game with very well thought out mechanics, skill trees and visuals.  The developer really knows what they are doing for the most part.  They also know that unlike D3, they need to be stingy with the drops so you don't run out of stuff to do.Anyway, I spent $20ish in extra stash tabs which is absolutely necessary if you want to play the game "semi-seriously" and it isn't a bad "donation" to the fine folks at Grinding Gear Games.  I do wish they would cave and put in a non cash auction house so I wouldn't have to dicker with the idiots, but the trading is far less painless then it used to be with most folks using POE trade which is a nice 3rd party site.All together I enjoy it more than D3.  I'd say that D3 is smoother running, slightly better graphics.  Path of Exile is a thinking person's game, I am very impressed with how the developer really thinks about the small things and is always trying to make the game better.  I highly recommend this game if you like the Diablo sort of play.  If you are going to try it I recommend giving POE a reasonable try since it is a slow starter and really only kicks in when you "invest" time and increase your knowledge base.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2014
												This is hands down the best Jew/Trading simulator out there. Definitely beats Recettear by a long shot. What makes it different from other Jew/Trading simulators out there is how there's no in-game money. Everything is valued in orbs, and the focus of the game is to get as many Chaos and Exalted Orbs as possible within a 4-month league. Sure, you can simply say, "but in that case, gold is basically chaos!" and you wouldn't be too far off. However, the items you trade in-game have no fixed value, can be negotiated for fractions of a Chaos/Exalt(which exist as other currencies), are negotiated by the players. Oh yeah, did I mention you trade with other players? That also makes it vastly different from Recettear.It's kind of hard to explain the nature of this game, you just have to trade to figure it out. 90% of unique items are valued at 1 chaos, which is pretty much as low as you'll want to go. Different currencies are available to split Chaos and Exalts, but pretty much do not have a set value themselves, aside from 8 Chance = 2 Scouring = 1 Regret and 8 Alteration = 4 Jeweler's = 1 Fusing. Again, the point of the game is to convert these currencies to Chaos, and eventually Exalts. Pro-tip: Convert your Exalts to Chaos within the first 2 months of a league, then buy Exalts within the last month/last 2 weeks.The Jew/Trading Simulator involves an ARPG minigame, but its not really worth noting compared to the depth of the Trading game. It's basically mind-numbing, "attach main attack/spell skill to a button, attach debuff(curse) to another button, spam both buttons" gameplay. This is due to the fact that BiS items such as Kaom's Heart and Bringer of Rain effectively drop the amount of usable skills by 1. Not only that, but gemslots and links also severely limit your amount of effective usable skills. Focusing on 1 skill is mandatory if you want effective DPS. The ARPG minigame gameplay focuses mostly on passive effects, so its not really that great. The drop rates for gaining items are terrible, so to succeed in this game, you buy good items at really low prices from players desperate to beat the gearchecks of the ARPG minigame, and you sell them for as high as people are willing to buy them.tl;dr 9.5/10, definitely worth your time. Best Jew/Trading simulator of all time.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2014
												An online version of Diablo in most respects. It approaches character development in a fairly interesting way which resembles Final Fantasy X-2 or XI more than the usual systems. Powers are also equipped using sockets on items which can be of different colours, skill gems are placed in these to equip the power. The gems level up along with your character getting more powerful the more baddies you kill. This means that item and equipment choice isn't just based on stats but on sockets aswell, especially as some skill gems enhance the games in linked sockets on the same item. The quests, baddies, and gameplay is very much DIablo 3 with several kinds of character to choose from etc. All in all it is a well executed jack and slash with interesting and varied action. Plus it's free!

content:
Posted: October 25, 2013
												ตัวเกมนั้นคล้ายๆได้อารมณ์แบบเดียวกับ Diablo Series มากสำหรับเวลาที่เล่นไปประมาณ 2 ชม. ได้รู้สึกถึงความน่าเบื่อซ้ำซากเล็กน้อยซึ่งถ้าเล่นกับเพื่อนเป็นปาร์ตี้แล้วจะช่วยลดความรู้สึกที่น่าเบื่อออกไปได้ส่วนหนึ่งแต่สุดท้ายแล้วก็แล้วแต่คนจะชอบด้วยสำหรับผมที่เป็นคอ fps มาเล่นเกมแนวนี้อาจจะทำให้ผมรู้สึกเบื่อง่ายไปหน่อยระบบเกมที่แตกต่างกับ Diablo ที่เห็นได้ชัดเจนเลยคือการ Upgrade Skills แบบ Passive ซึ่งจะมีให้ Upgrade อยู่เยอะมาก(มากกกก)บางคนถึงกับต้องอุทานออกมาว่า"สกิลอะไรเยอะแยะมากมายขนาดนี้ฟระ"แต่ถึงจะมีให้ Upgrade Skills มากมายก็จริงทำให้มันมีข้อดีคือเรานั้นสามารถที่จะแยกเล่นสายต่างๆได้อย่างอิสระเช่นเป็นนักเวทย์แต่สามารถ Upgrade Skill ที่ช่วยให้ถือดาบถือโล่ไปไล่ตีมอนได้ ส่วนระบบ Skills แบบ Active นั้นจะได้มาจากสิ่งที่เรียกว่าหิน Skills ที่สามารถดรอปได้จาก Monsters ทั่วไป ทำให้เราใส่ Skills ได้อย่างอิสระอีกเช่นกันอีกทั้งระบบการซื้อ-ขายของในเกมนั้นจะไม่มีสิ่งที่เรียกว่าเงินเข้ามา แต่จะมีการแลกเปลี่ยนสิ่งของแทนเช่นอาวุธ 1 อย่างสามารถแลกเปลี่ยนเป็นเศษของสิ่งของที่จะใช้แทนเป็นเงินได้ 1 เศษเสี้ยว พอเราสะสมได้ครบ 4 อันเราก็จะได้สิ่งของที่สมบูรณ์ที่จะพร้อมแลกเปลี่ยนเป็นสิ่งของอื่นๆได้อีกตาม Shop ทั่วไป ซึ่งไอเทมที่ไว้ใช้แลกเปลี่ยนนั้นจะมีหลากหลายรูปแบบมาก บางอันต้องใช้เยอะถึง 40 อันเพื่อที่จะรวมเป็นอันใหญ่ 1 อันสุดท้ายแล้วเกมนี้ที่ถูกจัดอยู่ในหมวดเกมฟรีซึ่งได้มีความที่เป็นมากกว่าเกมฟรีอีกเกมอย่างบอกไม่ถูก ตัวเกมอาจจะมีระบบแฝงอีกมากซึ่งตัวผมยังไม่ได้เจอ และอีกอย่างหนึ่งที่ผมคิดว่าดีเช่นกันคือเซิฟที่เราใช้เล่นมีเซิฟของ Singapore ให้เล่นอยู่ทำให้ช่วยลดอาการแลคได้พอสมควรเลยทีเดียว

content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												After having played path of exile for over 300 hours on many characters I have come to love this game. The depth of it's character and item customization is phenomenal. I find myself spending time outside of the game planning builds and discussing ideas with friends.I started playing the game in softcore leagues. I was too afraid of dying and losing all of the work I had done in the league. After I became comfortable with the game and started to improve my skills I moved into hardcore leagues and haven't looked back. At the time of this review my current character is level 67 and just getting ready to move into doing maps.Path of Exile's passive skill tree can be very daunting for a new player. It seems like you will never figure out what to do and feel overwhelmed. Many players use a guide on the forums from other players to learn how to play a certain build for a character and how to progress throughout the passive tree. Some people may say that having to look up how to play is bad but in my opinion it gets players to get more involved in the forums as well as into researching more about the game rather than just diving in and getting frustrated about not knowing what to do.The economy of the game is kept balanced through the fact that the currencies commonly used for trading are also used by players to try and upgrade their items. This keeps the game from flooding with currency and having tons of inflation. Hardcore leagues tend to have a better economy since players dying takes items out of the league and puts it into standard. Causing the number of items that are good in standard to rise constantly, hurting it's economy some.Even though Path of Exile has a limited number of classes and only 3 acts that are repeated multiple times per character and on every character, the passive tree, skill gem customization, and items cause people to want to keep playing the game and make new characters.My advice to new players is to not give up too fast because you feel overwhelmed. Take a few minutes to browse the forums or watch videos to learn about a build or how to play the game well. If you put in the time to learn about the game you will be glad you did and enjoy the game. There may be desync issues which can be frustrating but they are being worked on and they are not as bad as people make them out to be. You can easily play the game with those small issues and be fine.I am willing to help out new players with the game or questions they have about the game. Feel free to add me on steam or in game using xHamsterHunter.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2014
												---------------------------------------------------Path of Exile: "What Diablo 3 should  have been."                                         - Everyone Ever---------------------------------------------------PROS:- Always Free To Play & Never pay to Win.- Visual, Audio, and Gameplay aesthetics simular to Diablo 2, set in a 3D Enviroment.- Extensive skill tree (Web) featuring virtually limitless customization.- Tons of Skill Gem and Skill Support-Gem combinations availible, allowing for vast customisation of individual Skills/Spells.- Frequently updated content including Addons, Tweaks, and Fixes. - Close knit Developer & Community interaction.         (The Developers actually play the game, as they are designing a game that is fun to play.  So more often than not they are within reach of ingame Global chat.)CONS: - Boss battles arnt the most exciting.- Story line is sorta.. meh- Inevitably the end game becomes more about grinding to get better gear, and then grinding to get better gear.. Ad infinitum.- This game will Devour ALL your free time! :D

												Path is what I wanted Diablo 3 to be. It's a hack and slash game that's a pleasure to play, has a ton of customizaiton, with a setting and atmosphere that makes me uncomfortable, in a good way.The game itself is very fun, and the active community that adds tools for trading only help it. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 24, 2013
												Been playing this since start of alpha. If you love Diablo 2 and are looking for something to fill the void the dissapointing diablo 3 left this is where you need to go. POE uses a unique leveling system reminescent of the sphere grid of FF10, which was wicked. You get all your passives from the grid and augment your equipment with gems, the gem system has been done so many times, but POE got it right. Its so much fun mixing and matching, as all your active skills are on them. The story is very unique, as you are a exile from Wraeclast, a prisoner tossed to the side on an island. Here you will learn of the locals hardships and dark history. You move forward as the Adventurer who can only move forward. It has unique monsters with interesting movesets and modifiers and the story is set into 3 acts, with 3 difficulties you will not get bored fast. To top it all off, its a NZ based developed game, and supported by Brother Laz, the legend who kept Diablo 2 afloat with Median XL

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												For those of us that really loved the Diablo 2 model with its constant variability as far as maps and monsters go, Path of Exile, or PoE as it's known to most of it's users, is a must play.  PoE not only embodies the spirit of D2 and its expansions did but perfects 'loot pinata' model with complete costimazation.  Players are able to play any class however they want, with whatever weapons / armors they want, all because of the brilliant (and horrificly complicated) skill system.  Top off the customization with guilds, giving custom name abbreviations in chats and storage (when paid for), constant events that reward in game items / cosmetic pieces, and competative leagues and the dessert is all the better.  This game is a MUST play for all fans of the Diablo series. Grinding gear games, the developers for PoE, hit the nail on the head.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												Most action RPGs are dull or simplistic, in my opinion. I gave Path of Exile a chance because of its supernatural theme and was very pleasantly surprised. The gameplay is outstanding, the maps (Acts 1 - 4 so far) each have different environments such as dungeons, graveyards, forests, caverns, the sea shore, and so on, and the item and crafting systems are very robust and engaging. There is a Guild system and also player housing in the form of Hideouts which can become very complex and unique by completing daily missions for Masters (see PoE's Hideout of the Week for some examples). Overall, Path of Exile is a carefully designed, well thought out experience with an engaging story, offering an odd blend of Gothic horror, Diablo-like gameplay, and Kiwi culture (Grinding Gear Games is located in New Zealand). Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												Been playing this since when it came to Steam. Although sometimes I take a long break, I always come back to it. Since its skill tree is huge, it gives a lot of possibilities to try new builds and create new characters. For those with interest in the lore of the game, POE provides a different storyline from the other general RPGs out there. It is a dark and sad atmosphere with NPCs that fit those areas. The main characters also interacts with personal achievements through the game, like killing a boss or a special mob, saying unique quotes, making them part of that lore, and not a random passerby hero. POE provides also a great variety of items, with different stats that can be rerolled with certain orbs. If you want the item badly but you aren't satisfied with the stats, you can use a orb on it and try to reroll stats that fits your build.The downside is that if you are not into aRPGs, you'll feel very lost. Even those familiar with the genre must have been scared at the first glance. Also, there is this unfortunate desync that happens sometimes, and it sometimes kill you.Ah, and templar doesn't wear pants. Other than that, it's a great game and experience.

Posted: December 26, 2015
												I don't exactly what it is about this game, but I keep on grinding the game over and over. The new patches constantly add new content and challenges and I'm always curious to find out what's next. It's absolutely free, not pay to win - so go ahead and try it out!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												I have no idea where to start with this game. If you like Diablo II, then this game is a MUST. It starts off feeling like diablo, until you start gaining levels, and realize that just because you picked a class, doesn't mean your stuck building in a predetermined way. You can customize your character in just about anyways you please, with some work of course. Then, levels don't mean new skills. Just stats and bonuses. You skills come from gems that you either find as loot from your slain enemies, or from quests. The also require the right colored slot to place them in on your equipment, so that means finding the right gear with the right slots to use the skills you want. The game starts of nice and easy, get you feeling comfortable until you start progessing further and realize that you have to plan ahead. If your unprepared, you will get beaten to a bloody pulp while the game laughs at you. Of course, it is truely free to play, not pay to win. Nothing you can buy with real world money adds anythign except cosmetics. I've made several different characters, some of the same class, but heading in different ways, to great success... and not so great. The best, or worst part, is the fact that there is no gold in the game. Instead, you use other things to barter with the shops to get with you need, including scrolls and various other items used to help change your equipment. score: 8.5 out of 10. Only reason is the game itself is fairly short.

												At last, I have found a game that is, at least, the equal of my favorite dungeon crawler - Diablo. Path of Exiles is a supreme monster bash, with an interface that works perfectly for this genre of game. I have only just started playing it, but the monsters, the weapon rewards, the magic spells, the fighting, even the graphics depicting the heroes you play on screen. All of them incredibly satisfying. It also has a skill tree progression system, which works flawlessly while giving so much scope to develop your character in the way you want. Incredible game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												For those of us that really loved the Diablo 2 model with its constant variability as far as maps and monsters go, Path of Exile, or PoE as it's known to most of it's users, is a must play.  PoE not only embodies the spirit of D2 and its expansions did but perfects 'loot pinata' model with complete costimazation.  Players are able to play any class however they want, with whatever weapons / armors they want, all because of the brilliant (and horrificly complicated) skill system.  Top off the customization with guilds, giving custom name abbreviations in chats and storage (when paid for), constant events that reward in game items / cosmetic pieces, and competative leagues and the dessert is all the better.  This game is a MUST play for all fans of the Diablo series. Grinding gear games, the developers for PoE, hit the nail on the head.

												This is a super fun Diablo style action RPG.  While the "Microtransactions" are for the most part $3-5 in size (a little on the high side). Gameplay is solid and there is plenty of good quality voice acting behind the NPC interactions to keep it from being a mindless romp though the world. This is what I hoped Torchlight would be like (much cleaner and more customization options) and well worth the time to play.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												If I had played this before making my top 5 games of the year this game would have stolen 5th place from Saints Row 4.Top-down action RPGs or “Diablo clones” as many people like to call them rarely amuse me for more than two or three hours, Path Of Exile however is a different story. What makes Path of Exile so different? Well I think it is it’s character building that makes it so enthralling. I am playing as a witch, a necromantic witch using my own build; I summon hordes of zombies, skeletons & spectres to overwhelm my enemies whilst I hide in a corner & cry, occasionally raining down fire from the heavens. But that’s just one simple example of a huge number of possible builds each & every character can have.Each character starts at a certain part of the passive skill tree, it is incredibly daunting at first but you’ll soon realise that it’s one of the best thought out skill trees out there, I dare say maybe the best I’ve seen. A witch for example starts at the intelligence slice, then we have the ranger at dexterity, the marauder at strength; then three other classes with a mix of two attributes & finally the scion who will start dead centre & is unlockable after beating the game for the first time.     These classes are purely the starting point, the canvas on which you build your character.   Skills are not dictated by class but by how much intelligence, strength & dexterity you have.You will not gain them by levelling up, you will choose them from quest rewards & will find them as drops from killing enemies.All these factors contribute to a huge amount of replay-ability.There is no character creator so whilst you make look the same as every witch, ranger or shadow you may not play the same. As for the gameplay itself, it is standard for the most part for any game of this style.Kill hordes of enemies, gather tons of loot whilst completing various quests & once in a while take down a tough boss. It sounds just as tedious as any other top-down action RPG yet whilst playing as the witch it never felt like that, it felt more tactical than your standard hit attack button until all bad things are dead approach. The trading system is another great aspect of note, instead of collecting money you trade unwanted equipment for items & stack up enough of these items & you’ll get a usable or better item.These are normally things that will permanently boost the effectiveness of armour & weapons or add magical effects to them. You’ll even get items that will change normal items to rare items. If you trade three of the same flasks you’ll get a better flask that will heal more HP or restore more mana. This removes the annoyance of gold farmers & the monotony of grinding for gold.In fact speaking of removing annoyances & monotony, that seems to be this game’s goal, to remove the things that makes your typical Diablo style top-down action RPG so tedious; & they, in my opinion, have succeeded. Best of all Path of Exile is free & has the fairest free-to-play model I have ever seen, micro transactions are almost exclusively cosmetic with bank & character slot upgrades being the only exception.That’s right none of the pay-walls you would usually find in free-to-play games.Plus if you run it though Steam there is no need to make yet another account for an MMO. There is absolutely no reason anyone should not at least try this game. Fully recommended.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												This is what Diablo III should have been (at least in my opinion). It follows the tried and tested gameplay formula of this genre with an interesting character development system.Skills are based on gems that are found throughout the game.These need to be socketed into items to be used and these level up with you as long as they are socketed. In theory any class can use any skill (although skill level is limited by the appropriate stat). In addition to this there is a large passive skill matrix which is similar in style to the skill development in Final Fantasy 10 (If any of you remember that one). For those who don't, all character classes start at different places on the matrix and (in theory) can access any skill, although some skills are much easier to reach for certain classes. This means that character development is much more freeform than it is in a lot of other games of this type. I've only played three classes to level 20 or so so I don't know how the game holds up in the final stages, but it seems like an enjoyable, nicely put together game so far. It has PVP (which I haven't tried), regular events and (apparantly) a sizeable number of players. If you find yourself at a loose end one day and fancy taking a chance on an indie game, I'd recommend giving this one a try. Its free to play and as far as I can tell not pay to win, so what have you got to loose :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												Ever wanted to play a Hack & Slash RPG which has the spirit of the "old" Diablo 2 but in a modern way of thinking? Endless replay ability options with a lots of classes? Challenging monsters and bosses ? Epic storyline? Mighty loot?Well in this case your game is Path of Exile. You can play this game as purely a casual/occasional gamer for some quick fun or you can make a custom build for your character and go hardcore with the big guys. Really hard to compare with any games these days. Diablo 3 and Torchlight 2 shifts to a more casual and known aspect of H&K RPGs while Path of Exile tries something new like the unique skill tree, trading system and gem skills. Grinding Gear games furthermore provides a high level of support for this game which is very rare these days. And what’s the best in all this? You get everything for FREE, and don't need to pay for able to play 100% of the game. The only micro transaction options are purely cosmetic and do not give an advantage for players who can invest a large sum of money.  Graphics are realistic and the game runs fluently. The game gets hard at the end of Cruel and through Merciless difficulty so expect some party wipes, but as addressed before, this is more of a hardcore game, so get some skill.Overall, this game really worth your time if you happen to like RPGs or Hack & Slash type of games. Get some friends together or join a Public Party for whacking some monsters and show no mercy, because the land of Wraeclast won't do it either.9/10 Excellent

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												Quick intro, I have played this game more then steam shows, I was in on the beta about a year or more ago. Long time PC gamer, 26 years old living in the NW of the US.The good:- Best Skill system ever in a game, the amount of options and ways to modify skills is awesome.- Great loot and passive interaction with skills, this game was made to blend all the passives, skills and items into interesting combo's. Again best I have ever seen, and I have played Torchlight 1& 2, Diablo 3, Titan's quest, and dabbled in Diablo 2, and some of the earlier ARPG's (names are escaping me right now)- End game maps is a brilliant idea.- Lighting and mood of dungeons and caves always impress me.The Bad:- Desync made me quit this game twice... I have tried many fixes, searched endless hours on the internet how to improve my performance, but alas there is nothign the player can do. I have a great ISP, I have great speeds, great computer, an understanding of networking and such, I have no problems with other games. It is all server side, and it is frustering. People don't play some of the skills because they are known to cause desync, (movement attack skills like flicker, etc) It shocks me the developer doesn't focus on this issue more, i have heard that they can't fix it, that the problem is too deep into how they created/coded the game. I have also heard some of the communiuty defend it and say it is an acceptable part of the game. My oppinion is, if people avoid peices of your game because of a techinical issue, then it is broken, not a peice of the game. it HAS gotten better, but it is still there.- What makes it worse is the melee attack animations, it is easy to miss enemies. I don't know if their "hit" box or whatever you call it is the issue, but I have played with melee charcters that can't miss (skill) and either because of the desync or animation errors, my charcter misses, or hits but doesn't register, or something else. The animations add to that issue, they are choppy and not smooth, you don't have the feeling of impact all of the time. I have seen some comments that combat is smoother in Diablo or Torchlight and i would agree, from an animation standpoint.- Both of these issues lead to not wanting to play melee, or needing to play aoe melee and not a targeted melee. If you play ranged charcters this is less of an issue, but desync will still bother you. - Combat after a while tends to get bland, it doesn't have a fluid reactionary feel to it, you just spam a set bit of skills over and over and over and over. To be fair, most ARPGs are that way. But POE feels that way a little more.All that being said, I am excited for the future of this game. The developers have promised support and more content for a long while, maybe even years. The new exspansion coming in a couple of days should help with the stale combat, the new ultimate skills I think will give a little more flow.My Recommandation to the developer:1) Really focus on the desync and animation issues, I am not convinced that these can't be fixed. Other games don't suffer in this area, and this is the single greatest reason you game is not growing in even more explosive leaps and bounds.2) There needs to be a little more fluidity to combat, the greatest thing i have seen to help with this in other games was Console diablo 3 roll ability, you can actually dodge attacks. And what I haven't seen is some kind of counter magic, there are some shield abilities in this game, but I would love to see something that gives you the feeling that you are blocking, countering, something like that. Maybe even displacement skills? skills that knock back, interrupt, pop up? I am pulling from my MOBA experiance. Just an idea. Of course issue #1 will need to be fixed first because this would just make the issue worse.3) keep up with the item appearance diversity, it used to be bland and you guys have made the appearance of gear more interesting. Thank you for a great game, I hope to see more in the future!

Overview:TL;DR at the bottomWith the new Ascendancy update just released, I thought I'd write a review to give an general overview of what the game currently has to offer. Path of Exile has undoubtedly gotten better with each major update and the new Ascendancy update is no different, but it's important to know what you're getting into first. Gameplay:The main game is consists of 4 acts that are to be completed in each of the 3 difficulties (Normal, Cruel, and Merciless). After finishing act 3 in Merciless, you'll be able to get into endgame content in the form of 'maps' that'll let you get better gear the higher tier the map. At character creation, you have a choice of joining the Standard, Hardcore, or Challenge League. I highly recommend you get comfortable with the game mechanics first but switch over ASAP to a Challenge League as they add special features and rewards.Classes:In the base game, there are 6 classes unlocked at the start with emphasis on the three attributes: strength, intelligence, and dexterity. A 7th class is unlocked after completing act 3 Normal that has quick access to all 6 classes passives. With the new Ascendancy update, each of the 6 classes have 3 specialized classes that allow for potentially interesting builds. The 7th class only has 1.Passive Tree:PoE has a very complicated and large skill tree that can be extremely daunting to new players. However, once you become familiar with it you'll be able to see how even a melee oriented class such as the Marauder can become a spellcaster almost as well as the spell focused Witch class. I would still recommend that new players consult a build guide on the pathofexile forums to get an idea of how to navigate the tree.Skills:Each skill comes in the form of a gem that is socketed into all equipment minus belts, jewellry, and quivers. The game includes support gems that allow for skills to link into them for some powerful combinations.Trading:Trading is a core part of the game but is arguably not required to progress through the main game. Trading usually involves orbs that you'll find throughout the game with chaos orbs being the silver standard and exalted orbs the gold standard. Much of the dislike for the trading system comes from having to rely on 3rd party websites like PoE Trade to be able to set prices, or price match an item you may want to sell. The Ascendancy update is the first of many trade improvements that now allow players that have purchased premium stash tabs to set prices for items individually.Microtransactions (mtx):The game is completely free to play with no content locked away meaning a character from Normal can reach endgame maps without paying a dime. Most of the shop consists of cosmetic effects such as armor, weapon effects, pets, etc. However, stash tabs (for storing items) and character slots (you get 24 at first) range from $15-20 USD. I firmly believe if you've made it to act 4 Merciless and are getting ready for maps to consider supporting the game. It normally takes over 20 hours for a character to reach the endgame for the first time, and by that time I feel the game should have value.Performance:While not a large concern performance is still something to consider especially if you don't have at least a mid-tier pc. There are many monsters that can appear on screen at once with additional particle effects that can literally fill the entire screen. This could mean a big CPU and GPU hit, and it is advised for laptop or low-end pc's to do some custom tweaking to the graphics. Also, it's known that an SSD can vastly improve load times going into new zones (I have an HDD and don't think it's very long at about 20 seconds per transition).TL;DR:Path of Exile is a fantastic free-to-play game that now has become even better with character build diversity and general game improvements from the new Ascendancy update.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
												Having put in around 90+ hours or so now. I have found the game to be pretty fun! .. for a FtP (free to play) titleVery "Diablo 2 'ish", which is near the top of my "favorite games all time" list. When I first started, I saw the large 4 free bank tabs and was excited ... but, there are a number of things /mechanics built into the game that require the storage of items to be utilized effectively. It's a choice one would have to make on if it's worth it or not to dig-in to that element, and use the bank space for that .. or not (e.g. crafting, corrupted talismans for use in the stone circles, etc...). It really caters to my hoardish tendencies by allowing me to "buy" more bank space.. if I just gott'a keep stuff lol  .. I especially like that "if" I choose to use $$$ for anything, it would be "bank space" or "cosmetic" things, not "pay to win".I've not engaged in the PvP portion of the game so I can't comment on that aspect of it... but it is "optional", and you can't be killed unless you choose to PvP with one of your characters (in the arena or in a 1 vs. 1 dual). I literally turned off the "notification for duel challenge", so I've not even been bothered by that.There isn't really any currency in the game ...no gold or money of any type ...as everything boils down to three categories (which are all tradable): consumables (e.g. ID scrolls and Portal scrolls), gear (which includes weapons and armor, as well as Skill gems and Passive Jewels), and crafting consumables (which includes all the different types of "Orbs"). Orbs, have basically become the de facto currency as the end-game really revolves around customization and "modding" of a players gear to be "better" at what ever path they have chosen with their characters build.Speaking of character builds, the thing that stands out the most for me in this game is it's extensive "passive" skill-tree, and the use of "skill gems" for all active build functionality. The passive skill-tree for all classes is the same. The only thing that changes by "picking a class" is "where" within that skill-tree you start. You get most of your passive skill points through leveling, but there are some one-time quest rewards that offer them, as well as one-time quest rewards for changing them once applied. The changing is on a "one at a time" basis, so if you later decide to go down a different build path, you can reclaim them, in reverse order.  So, as you invest skill points out a "branch" in the skill tree, to reclaim those skill points, you would need to back them out from the farthest tip of a branch until you get to the last skill you want to keep. As you do so, one by one, you can then put each point reclaimed back in, on the new path you want to go down. There are semi-rare "orbs" that drop that allow a player to respect a point, but if one really wanted to make a large scale change, it would probably be easier to just level up another character.Some of the things I didn't like "as much" as the solo play, was the "Multiplayer" (partying) and "Guild" functions, which I tried briefly. Concerning "Multiplayer", I am not sure exactly how the game decides on some things, but certain drops are individual.. while others are group. OK, but when playing with a new'ish player, it was a little frustrating having to talk through with them "why" they should be picking some things up (because of certain vendor "recipes" .. basically "special" bonus vendor items and item combos which the vendors pay handsomely for with higher-end crafting materials), instead of just being able to grab everything of value and give it to them later. It turned out my "helping them" was slower than if they had done things themselves. Concerning "Guilds", the functionality seems to be there, but for any functionality, $$$ would need to be spent to purchase "Guild Bank Box" and "Additional Guild Member Slots (10 at a time)"  beyond the default ...uhh how ever many it was.. 10?All in all, I am liking it and will continue to play. With that, I do recommend the game for those who like RPG gamesSo here is how it stacks up for me (so far):Story: .................... 8/10 - (it is pretty dark, but these are demons and dead were dealing with)Gameplay: ............. 8/10Graphics: ............... 9/10Mechanics: ............ 7/10Diversity: ............... 8/10Crafting: ................ 8/10 - (although I am really new to it's true depth and functionality)Social / multiplayer: 5/10 - (with general public grouping, but maybe 7/10 with true friends)PvE (PvM): ............. 9/10 (Solo Play)PvP: ...................... "unknown" - as I've yet to engage in that activity .. it's not really my thingEnd-game: ............ "unknown" - as I haven't reached the end-game content yetReplayability: ........ "unknown" - but it looks like it "could" be fun.. for me anywayAt the time of this writing, they are just a few days from releasing their next big "free" expansion called "Ascendancy", which will introduce both, a lot of new content, as well as launch their next season (which they call "Leagues"). The result of the patch that hit yesterday is causing a bit of havoc, but I was not hardest hit.. just moderately effected... in that the game is crashing to log-in screen pretty frequently for me. So...Patches / Updates:   5/10 Based on my experience with this, my first patch and update, I don't recommend playing any Hard Core characters around them  lol With Seasonal Hard Core (HC), your character doesn't experience "true" death (like Diablo's HC), it just gets kicked out of the current seasonal League play, and bumped back to the non-seasonal "Standard League".

content:
Posted: October 23, 2013
												Excellent hack and slash with a visual style similar to Diablo 3 but very novel mechanics that are fun to play with, such as swappable abilities that are socketed into items, a huge passive skill tree (hundreds of nodes with many major nodes causing very significant changes to existing mechanics), and a economy centred around consumable exchanges not gold. Races and season-long challenge leagues add to the fun and add incentive to play new builds and to revisit earlier areas. It plays great, but is online-only even when played solo. But don't play solo, play with me!

content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												Fantastic ARPG. This game is very reminiscent of Diablo 2 and other RPG's in the 90's and early 2000's.Take your time learning the game and how to build characters. You should not feel discouraged if your first (maybe first few) characters do no hold up well in the end game. The true test of your character build is upon reaching level 60-70, any changes afterwards are usually too little too late.Spend some time looking at other people's builds, and what % of their build is focused on defensive/offensive or utility passives. It'll be less time overall than building a character to 60-70 and starting over, I've done that a few times.I'm impressed that this game is so enjoyable as a free to play game, and love the microtransaction system. You buy particle effects, models, and stash tabs. None of these correlate to a pay to win model.EDIT: The last paragraph here was in the original review but is no longe true, the latency issues and Out-Of-Sync complications have been fixed. Justto show that the devs are listening to the community and improving the game constantly. I've been playing for 4 years now, I always enjoy coming back to this game when a new ladder starts and testing new abilities/uniques. Good job Grinding Gear Games, you guys rock.#######The following paragraph is no longer true but is still included to show ongoing game improvement#########The only major downside to this game is the current status of the servers in the evening. Latency jumps from 100 average, to 400-600. Poor optimization also causes movement-based skills (Cyclone, Whirling Blades, Leap Slam) to consistently desync with the server, usually resulting in player death.

												A rock-solid action RPG with amazing visuals, tactical gameplay and a deep metagame. Characterised by a vast skill tree (worth looking for if you haven't seen it before), the "race" gametypes, and the smooth change between co-op and solo. content:
Posted: March 19, 2016
												Diablo 3 was my first ARPG. For some reason I never tried ARGP games in my long gaming history. I thought that Diablo 3 was already quite entertaining for the first 100 hours or so, but after that I got extremely bored. Then I tried PoE, mainly because people were comparing it with the 'legendary' Diablo 2 all the time. I have the feeling the I haven't discovered the biggest part of the game. PoE has completely taken me by surprise with its extreme details in gameplay and gamemechanis, its dark gritty atmosphere, and its thrilling (hardcore) gameplay. POE is the deepest aRPG slasher ever made. It uses some tested ideas while introducing highly innovative systems and end-game mechanics. To put it straight Path of Exile is AAA+ game FREE of charge. No pay to win. Grind to win! The game is quite polished already future announcements make you connected to Wreaclast even more. Devs give their best, the rapport is great and from what i've seen in the past year the were 25+ patches, constant tweaking with the mechanics, skill tree* and skills. Dedication is the way Grinding Gear works. They way they introduce changes clearly shows how they care. *The sheer size of the skill tree is a guarantee jaw drop if seen for the first time.

Posted: November 25, 2013
												This game is commonly refered to as the true spiritual successor to Blizzard's Diablo 2, And while this is very true. I think it detracts from the fact that Path of Exile is an Excellent game even without the Diablo 2 influence.Do you enjoy Action Role Playing Games? If you answered yes, then this game is for you. It is also free to play, and not pay to win. So the game uses one of the better Free to Play models out there, similar to TF2 where only cosmetics and inventory space cost actual money.Bottom line, this game takes a lot of what previous ARPGs have done successfully, and then adds a lot of it's own ideas and concepts into the mix. I could list out all the great reasons to play, but basically, if you like RPG's and you have NOT played this, then it is time to start. It is free, so you have no excuse not to try it out.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Path of Exile is one of the most engaging ARPGs I've played lately.  I'd highly recommend this to fans of Diablo or Torchlight who wish that there were a few more ways to customize their character.  The classes are diverse (and customizable) and combat is intense and sufficiently difficult.All skills in the game are contained in gems, which are slotted into equipment similar to how materia was equipped in Final Fantasy VII.  Also, character progression is done through a non-linear system that reminds me of the Sphere Grid from Final Fantasy X.  There is no hard currency (such as gold or gems) in the game.  Instead, there is a wide variety of customization orbs that can be traded as currency to either vendors or other players.I've had a lot of fun playing PoE, and find myself coming back to it whenever I want to play a good action-oriented smash-and-loot game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												I just got this on Steam but played since Closed Beta. 200+ Hours into this game. I started with a level 51 Summoner Witch, then started a Ranger, got to Level 71 Lightning Arrow crit build. Now I've made a Marauder 2 handed Mace build with Ground Slam/ Hatred Aura for cold damage and he is at level 78 going on 79. The game is addictive.The Skill system is unique and fresh. The passive tree is a little offputting to noobs but it makes sense and is great after some getting used to. The battles and bosses are fun and require planning in later difficulties. Maps at the end are fun with friends, I like crafting my own level 70 maps and doing them :P or doing 66-67 maps with some magic find gear on. Trading is a bit rough, I like the currency system with orbs, but they do need an in game auction house (NOT WITH REAL MONEY). People use POE.XYZ online to sell items mostly its an item search engine. Trade chat is abysmal at best. If you like action RPG's this is much more fun than Diablo 3.  This game is free, and worth much more. I put in $20 to support developers and get 6 new stash tabs :P TRY IT

												Portuguese version at the end!Path of Exile is a great game. ARPG just like Diablo and Lost Ark (some skills look like, too, but no problem)From my view, this game have a lot of potential, is not that old and will sure get better and better.Pros:            - Huge skilltree. Serious. Huge. Not kidding. The largest I know.          - Good story and voices, even for your skills (that amuse me a lot)          - Fast action          - Easy to learn          - Amazing soundtrack          - Good geography (you can access almost every single area of the game with one of your portals)          - No pay-to-win at all          - Constant patches and enhancements          - Skills are not bond to classes, you can drop skill gems and use them in all classes          - Equipments skill chain: you can chain skills alltogether, making nice combos and become badass          - Nice way to lvl up your gear and specially weapons (epic and unique stuff) Cons:           - If you don't know what you are doing with your skill tree, you will suck at higher difficulties. Look for guides and builds          - The difference between difficulties is big. If you don't lvl up you gear often, at one point going to the next area will be really tough, and at one map you can slay them all; but at the next you just die          - The secret about surviving to higher difficulties is raising your resistence status. But at lower levels this is hard to do, and you may farm for a long time to get a cool gear with elements resistence to continue          - Questbook is really simple, and not much side quests. Is like straight forward to the ending          - Is quite hard to get to max lvl. With my game hours I'm just half way (this is not really bad, cause you must play a lot to get strong, meaning more fun days)         - At higher levels, when you die you lose too much experience and it take long to have it back to where it wasBut at all, Path of Exile is a great choice. For those ARPG fans out there (7 years of Diablo 2 LOD and 500+ hours of Diablo 3, that's what we're talking here) I highly recommend this experience.And for those curious little minds, why not give it a try? You may like it, and it's for free!Resuming, that's all.Zung------------------ Portuguese ------------------Path of Exile é um bom jogo. É um jogo estilo ARPG como Diablo e Lost Ark (algumas habilidades parecidas, também, mas sem problema)Sob meu ponto de vista, este jogo tem um grande potencial, não é tão velho e com certeza vai ficar cada vez melhor.prós:           - Enorme skilltree. Sério. Enorme. Não estou brincando. A maior que eu conheço.           - Boa história e vozes, até nas habilidades (eu gosto muito de dublagens)           - Ação rápida           - Fácil de aprender           - Trilha sonora surpreendente           - Boa geografia (você pode acessar quase todas as áreas do jogo com um de seus portais)           - Você não precisa pagar pra ganhar           - Correções e melhorias constantes           - As skills não são de uma única classe, você pode pegar umas pedras de habilidades e usá-las em todas as classes           - Equipamentos com habilidades encadeadas: você pode criar cadeias de habilidades, criando combos maneiros e ficando mais forte           - Ótima maneira de upar a seus equipamentos e especialmente armas (épicas e únicas)     contras:           - Se você não sabe o que está fazendo com a sua árvore de habilidade, você vai sofrer com as maiores dificuldades. Procure por guias e builds pra te ajudar           - A diferença entre as dificuldades é grande. Se você não melhorar seus equips, muitas vezes, ir para a próxima área será muito difícil, e em um mapa, você pode matar todos; mas no próximo você simplesmente morre           - O segredo para sobreviver nas maiores dificuldades está em elevar sua resistência (em geral). Mas em níveis mais baixos isso é difícil de fazer, e você pode ter que farmar por um longo tempo para obter um bom equipamento com resistência a elementos e só depois continuar.           - As missões são muito simples, e não tem muitas side quests. É basicamente seguir direto para o fim           - É muito difícil chegar ao level máximo. Com minhas horas de jogo eu estou apenas na metade do caminho (o que não é muito ruim, porque você tem que jogar muito para chegar lá, ou seja, mais dias de diversão)          - Em níveis mais altos, quando você morre você perde muita experiência, e leva muito tempo para voltar até onde estavaMesmo assim, Path of Exile é uma ótima escolha. Para os fãs de ARPG (estou falando com 7 anos de Diablo 2 LOD e mais de 500 horas de Diablo 3) eu recomendo esta experiência.E para aquelas pequenas mentes curiosas, por que não dar uma chance? Você pode gostar dele, e é de graça!Resumindo, isso é tudo....Zung

content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
												A rather good singleplayer experience in the vein of classic Diablo. Surprisingly polished for a free-to-play title, I especially like the perk web and skill gems compared to static skill trees, and the NPCs actually have sensible things to say - at least for your first go around.No payment necessary to play and advance, as all paid content is cosmetics, which I think is rather fair.The multiplayer is okay, but PvE gets dull fast, as there is not enough variety to pose a challenge and the skills that are fun in singleplayer quickly turn into overpowered steamrollers in multiplayer. Bosses are are a little limited for a modern game, very few different stages and either the fight is over fast or gets protracted. The lenient respawn system alleviates frustration.I would definitely recommend the game for anyone into hack'n'slash, as it is free and of decent quality.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												This game looks and feels like a spiritual successor to Diablo 2, arguably even surpassing it.     Enormous passive skill tree that replaces flat stat increases on level up and shared between all classes in the game. Nodes vary between flat and percent increases to various stats to some unique modifiers that completely change things around. Picking different classes starts you out in different areas of that tree with complete freedom to develop in any path you desire from that point, creating countless build variants.    Active skill tree is replaced with skill gem system in which gems are your active skills which you can level up separately and socket in your gear as you see fit. Further more, those gems can be combined creating different skill effects and sometimes even changing the way the affected skills work. Amount of available skill gems is just as enormous as the passive skill tree.    The standard gold currency is replaced with various orbs of varying values and rarity, creating a barter trade system between players and NPCs. These orbs can be applied to your gear to modify it. Depending on the orb used it is possible to change item quality or rarity, add or remove bonus properties, change number of gem sockets, socket coloring and links or re-roll bonuses or their numeric values. This means, with enough luck you can essentially craft any item from the common quality gear with no bonus stats. This adds another layer of depth to the game.    If you are feeling competitive, there are different leagues with different rule sets modifying core game experience. Small races are hosted on a 24/7 schedule which bend game rules even further to create some fun challenges. Participating in them earns you points which are used to reward your account with race exclusive gear based on how much points you have at the end of the racing season.    On top of all this its completely FREE to play, without any pay to win shenanigans. The only item in the cash shop that can affect your gameplay experience in any way is extra storage tabs in your shared loot stash, everything else is purely cosmetic stuff ranging from gear skins and skill effect skins to passive pets.     However, this game is difficult to get into. It has a somewhat slow and effortless start followed by almost vertical vertical difficulty wall hitting you in the face once you switch to harder difficulty. This, combined with passive skill tree and gems total freedom of choice and complete randomness of loot means that your first character will most likely end up as a big disappointment and scrapped mid way through the game. It is impossible to beat all three difficulties in this game without careful planning of your build, skills and gear. But as soon as you get comfortable with game mechanics and synergies the game sucks you in and you start trying different builds all the time.Bottom line, If you liked playing Diablo 2 or any other ARPG before, it would be a mistake not to give Path of Exile a try.PS:I also forgot to add an important detail. The game suffers from slight desync from time to time, usually it's tied to some skills that involve jumping teleporting or any kind of fast movement. If you decide to play on hardcore league this can become a major annoyance. The game has a built in chat console command (/oos) to combat this, but sometimes you just don't have time to type that in and not everyone likes or can use keyboard macros or tools like Autohotkey.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2015
												Best game I have ever played. I have played a great many game sbut none has held my attention this long. Even after 5000 hours I am still going, and even discovering new things. I look forward to every update and every aspect of the game is amazing.What keeps me playing this is the loot. Due to the randomness, it does take a long time to find an amazing item, but it feels so good when you finally get something cool. You can find things that are truly rare and have a lot of value, and when they nerf items they usually don't change the existing ones, creating a very interesting economy on the long-term leagues while balancing the short term to be fair. The "high end" of items is so high that long-term play is rewarded and makes it so that you ALWAYS have something to upgrade on your char.Some people may be put off with the system of trading, since there isn't an auction house or anything. However, I like it as you can actually find good deals on things and haggle with people, which is a lot harder to do when you are just clicking the lowest number on the list. While the main way to find people to trade with is to use a 3rd party site that indexes people's forum shops, it is actually not too bad since that site is very widely use and enables you to simply list your items for sale on the official forum, and then wait for any buyers to come to you as opposed to spamming trade chat for hours. Some people may be intimidated by the game economy and the fact that the desirable items are expensive, but once you learn how to make money you can save up for those items by putting a bit of effort in. Also, while the top tier builds often use expensive items, you can do perfectly fine with self found or items that fit your budget.The passive skill tree and the skill system are amazing. This is the only game I have played where you can truly do what you want to do, and there are so many combinations that even the developers don't anticipate what people can do. I have made a great many chars to explore these possibilities.Leveling to endgame isn't a chore at all, and is pretty quick. The grind at endgame gets exponentially more difficult as you try to level to the cap, but the way endgame is designed you can do all content long before you ever reach that cap. Leveling at endgame is more about improving your character and less about being required to play the content.Microtransactions are nearly all cosmetic, with the exception of bank space. Even with the default bank size you can work around with some inventory tetris and extra "mule" characters.The only downside to the game is that it can be a bit intimidating when you look at the huge passive tree, and have no idea what you really need for a successful character (for example, a common mistake is not getting enough life). Combat usually has you focus on a single skill with a lot of support skills as opposed to multiple major damage sources, but they have been working on improving this and it is  much better than when I started.Customer service is unrivaled. You can email support, and during their work hours you will usually recieve a human reply within minutes to any question you want to ask them.This is my favorite game by far and I cannot find anything better for what it offers.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												New review:Notice: This review is nor based on my recent experience. I last played this game like half of year ago. I doubt, though, that it is that different right now.This gem of a game is 100% free. I consider it Diablo 2 LoD's successor and better than Diablo 3. The only way I would not recommend this is if you try to have a life and you find yourself getting addicted to games.2-3 words about gameplay:I think that the photos and the videos in description tell enough about what this game is all about. But from those, you cannot really see how polished this thing is. It is one of the best games in the genre. All that you can buy with real money is some stash space, visual effects and character slots, but bear in mind that even without any purchase you get a lot more space than in other games by default (and more character slots) so this is not really needed. I got a cat (a pet that runs after the player) just for saying "thank you for making this great game".For those familiar with the genre, this game also has Hardcore Mode. After you die, you are just transfered to the non-hardcore server. Though for me that equals death - it is way better than sudenly being unable to do anything with it. Diablo 3's deaths felt to be more dramatic, though. (but it may be just me)This game, as an mmo, is a little different, as you may meet some of the people in cities, but not on the feeld. To be able to do that, they need to be in your party. This is mostly a PVE game. Though, unlike other games, you don't have to make/join rooms (they are created automatically / masked as joining public parties) - and this makes it a lot better.The game has a story, good visuals, and, by me, really few bugs. It does hog on resources on few maps, though (I'm thinking on the forest level right now) and, as I do have a new pc, I don't currently know, but in the past your game could freeze for a shor moment when a lot of new spells were suddenly appearing (I'm thinking of meeting Piety area here) - enough for you to die. But if you don't have some ancient pc as I used to have....Also, this game comes equiped with all that you need for Twitch TV, and features competitions!!! as in "Who levels the most in 2 hours" (for example). They are a lot of fun, even if you don't get to be on the first place... or top 100... or 500...All in all, just grab a friend and try this. If you don't have a friend, just grab yourself and try this.Since my brain works rather randomly, any suggestions and fixes to this review are appreciated. Also, bear in mind that Steam has an international community (aka: don't gut me for my English - you are welcome to correct me, though, just don't add hateful remarks)Old review:In few words, the best game in the genre since Diablo II Lord of Destruction.

												Best Action RPG I've ever played. The skill system is awesome, the passive skill tree has 1350 nodes on it, and the itemization and progression is perfect. Couple all those features with developers that actually care about their game, and put out new patches/updates at least every 2 weeks, and this game becomes one of the best hack 'n slash dungeon crawlers ever made. If you liked Diablo 2, but weren't a fan of Diablo 3 (because let's be honest, this game plays A LOT like those games) then this is the game for you. I definitely see it as the true spiritual successor to Diablo 2. One of my most recommended games ever, all at the price of free, with no pay to win bull crap. DOWNLOAD THIS GAME.
