number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												If you are a fan of Old School Action RPG ( the kinds of Diablo 1 and 2) then there is probably no better game out there than this one. I'll give you a small list of things to expect from this amazing game:Pros:- Free to play. Need i say more... And the fact that all purchases are 100% cosmetic or quality of life. ABSOLUTELY NO ADVANTAGES CAN BE BOUGHT. Need i say more :).- Enourmous Talent tree, making hundreds of viable builds.- Skill system based on gems, making combos of skills a maze of choices.- Constant updates and great community.- Plenty of leagues and challenges always poping up, including the odd race weekend leagues.- Almost all resolutions supported, easy on the machine.- End game is extensive, not to say endless, and everything is interchangeable between characters.Cons:- Online only.- Could have the option to zoom out a little further.- Still "incomplete", huge patch coming up summer of 2017 which i believe will make things even more awesome.- Some people don't adapt easily to the mouse movement.For those deciding to start the exile path, a few tips out of the box:- Search for Loot filter, find one that suits you, and put it in the game. You don't know the time you will save searching for loot until after you done it.- Vendor recipies are a thing. So for the beggining search for the Chromatic Orb(Three linked sockest of different collors) and Chaos Orb ones, they make a big impact in the long run.- Thouroughly search the UI options and make it up to your liking (Heck, i didn't have a minimap up until i was going at the 30 or more hours).In the end, you will make A LOT of mistakes on your first toon due to the complexity of the learning curve, but if you are an ARPG fan, there is no better game out there.9.5/10 - Could be better still, and maybe the note should be around 8.5, but there are so many constant updates and HUGE patches, it's completely free,  that i feel it deserves to be called The best when it comes to its genre.

												I already played the hell out of it in when it was in beta, so I don't have very many hours in steam. It's like diablo 2, I guess. You know what? I suppose there may be only 2 things that I would even need to bother putting in this reccommendation. 1. It's a good game and it's worth playing. 2. It is not by any means whatso-fricking-ever pay-to-win. People call it pay-to-glow, since a lot of the microtransactions you can get involve little things you can put on your weapons to give them glowing effects. There's also pets and stuff. The only potential gameplay advantage you can get from paying is from getting extra bank tabs. Even then, you don't really need them if you're not a pack rat, and they're inexpensive and permanent anyway.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												I haven't played much but this is what i can tell you...By far one of best games I have ever played. Even though it's free I played it more than the other 60 games in my library combined that i actually paid for. The skill tree is massive and might take a few hours if not a couple days to figure what playstyle you want. Pros+ Even though there are 7 classes to choose from (6 at the start 7th unlocked when you beat the story at least one time) you are not limited to a playstyle with that character. If you choose a witch you don't have to use spells or have a certain type of armour, a marauder is not limited to using weapons, and the ranger isn't only for bow and arrow.+ Skill gems. There are over 100 different skill gems, and a littler over 70 support gems used to enhance your skills. They range from physical, defensive, ranged, traps, and spells.+ Maps. End game content used after completing the story.+ Party. Up to 6 people can play together.+ Guilds.+ There is hardcore and unlike most games when you die you keep your character but it is no longer hardcore instead you get placed into a different league known as standard. Some keep playing that character and others go back to hardcore because they enjoy the challenge of not dying.+ A lot of unique items created by developers and some from the community. Some are used as leveling gear, others as vendor food, and the best for endgame. However, a handful if not most will need planning to be fully utilized.+ Every 4-5 months there are 2 new leagues. A standard and hardcore league seperate from regular standard and regular hardcore. These leagues includes extra content different for each league. When the leagues are over everthing acquired through that gameplay is shift over to their corresponding standard and hardcore, so nothing is lost.+ No actual set currency (gold, money, etc). There is currency but the value can shift over time. Used to trade currency for other currency, or items you need. The currency are actual items in the game used to imporve and sometimes even completely make your item useless, which can be frustrating at times but everyone loves science. However, if you are lucky enough your gear can become so amazing that the currency you used to buy that gear (unless you found it) is worth more currency. Makes sense I promise.+ Many games that are free becomes pay 2 win or start out that way, and this is one of the best parts. This game is not. Stuff bought with actual money are cosmetics. The only thing that is not cosmetics are stash tabs. People can argue that stash tabs are pay 2 win but the stash you start out with can manage, but your actual player cannot be improved with actual money.+ Masters. There are 7 masters that randomly spawn during your quest and by completing their side mission they gain experience and they eventually level up. They even become a vendor in which you can buy either items, gems, or discounted currency depending on their level.+ Hideouts. You can customize your own hideout starting with 7 different tileset depending on which master you ask to make the hideout. By completing master missions you gain favor which you use to buy their decorations. + Races. Every once in Grinding Gear Games have races in which you compete with others to earn certain gear with alternate art. The races vary from short 12 min burst gameplay to 1-2 hours of surviving the game.Pros/Cons+- Slow start at first but when it picks up pace you are gonna wish you slowed down even more. Your first character is most likely not gonna be your only character or even the character you are gonna play the most. Unless you despise fun of course and quit the game.+- Trade chat. Even harder than hardcore in this game. When you finally understand the lingo used in trade chat and what people want, how much they want, and how much certain gear or currency is worth. There are websites like poe.trade where you include general or specific gear that you want, find out who is selling it in game, and the best price or even negotiate with them. Be careful of idiots who overprice, and do your research well. There is also a third party program used in conjuction with the shop forums on pathofexile.com called procurement. Just look up a guide on how to use it on Youtube and also the guide on how to log in when using a steam account.+- There is no easy way to change your skill tree. You can complete missions that award refund points or use actual items in the game that refund skill points, but the items is a type of currency worth a decent amount depending on what setting you play. However when a league ends everyone gets a full reset on the skill tree and you can either improve your current character, or completely change their playstyle. In my opinion I enjoy not having an easy way to change my skill tree, it would make the game too easy.+- PVP. I don't play PvP much so don't base your answer of whether or not to play this game if you enjoy PvP in games. From what I played and what I've heard PvP isn't so big in this game. Sometimes the queue can last a while, but in my opinion it's growing.+- Some of the microtransactions do look very nice but is a little pricey in my opinion, but if you love the game enough and don't care about money then go crazy. Cons- Desync. One of the number one killers in this game. Sometimes random lag will attack your character and you don't know where you are and then you die. Countered by being very tanky though.My only regret is not playing this game at the very start of its creation and not giving it a chance. I would be a lot richer.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												It's a good fun game in the vein of the original Diablo's before the "re-imagining" of Diablo III. Very different in style than Torchlight II, this game is dark, and foreboding and it really feels like you vs everone else.I play it mostly as single player and the occaisonaly net glitches don't tract from a brilliant single-player experience. The skill tree is huge and innovative and will probably take many replays to fully appreciate. The micropayments system is done right, without any pay-to-win or pay-to-continue type extortions you find in other free-to-play games.Totally enjoying this game, and it's both great to just dip into for the odd hour or so, or to get lost in for a day.

												Great F2P Action RPG. Modelled closer towards the vein of Diablo 2 than Diablo 3 was. There is no buying power, the microtransactions are cosmetic with the exception of extra stash tabs.Sporting the most verbose talent tree in ages, you are sure to be able to create the character you want to play.Surprising amount of replayability with the leagues, updated pretty often. I've been playing it off and on for the past 2 and a half years and I have to say it's probably my favorite F2P title in recent memory.You owe it to yourself to try it out if you haven't.

												Insanely huge passive tree with an indepth skill system (skill gems) and a unique currency system. Highly addictive though it does get a bit slow after lvl 70 ish. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												Quick intro, I have played this game more then steam shows, I was in on the beta about a year or more ago. Long time PC gamer, 26 years old living in the NW of the US.The good:- Best Skill system ever in a game, the amount of options and ways to modify skills is awesome.- Great loot and passive interaction with skills, this game was made to blend all the passives, skills and items into interesting combo's. Again best I have ever seen, and I have played Torchlight 1& 2, Diablo 3, Titan's quest, and dabbled in Diablo 2, and some of the earlier ARPG's (names are escaping me right now)- End game maps is a brilliant idea.- Lighting and mood of dungeons and caves always impress me.The Bad:- Desync made me quit this game twice... I have tried many fixes, searched endless hours on the internet how to improve my performance, but alas there is nothign the player can do. I have a great ISP, I have great speeds, great computer, an understanding of networking and such, I have no problems with other games. It is all server side, and it is frustering. People don't play some of the skills because they are known to cause desync, (movement attack skills like flicker, etc) It shocks me the developer doesn't focus on this issue more, i have heard that they can't fix it, that the problem is too deep into how they created/coded the game. I have also heard some of the communiuty defend it and say it is an acceptable part of the game. My oppinion is, if people avoid peices of your game because of a techinical issue, then it is broken, not a peice of the game. it HAS gotten better, but it is still there.- What makes it worse is the melee attack animations, it is easy to miss enemies. I don't know if their "hit" box or whatever you call it is the issue, but I have played with melee charcters that can't miss (skill) and either because of the desync or animation errors, my charcter misses, or hits but doesn't register, or something else. The animations add to that issue, they are choppy and not smooth, you don't have the feeling of impact all of the time. I have seen some comments that combat is smoother in Diablo or Torchlight and i would agree, from an animation standpoint.- Both of these issues lead to not wanting to play melee, or needing to play aoe melee and not a targeted melee. If you play ranged charcters this is less of an issue, but desync will still bother you. - Combat after a while tends to get bland, it doesn't have a fluid reactionary feel to it, you just spam a set bit of skills over and over and over and over. To be fair, most ARPGs are that way. But POE feels that way a little more.All that being said, I am excited for the future of this game. The developers have promised support and more content for a long while, maybe even years. The new exspansion coming in a couple of days should help with the stale combat, the new ultimate skills I think will give a little more flow.My Recommandation to the developer:1) Really focus on the desync and animation issues, I am not convinced that these can't be fixed. Other games don't suffer in this area, and this is the single greatest reason you game is not growing in even more explosive leaps and bounds.2) There needs to be a little more fluidity to combat, the greatest thing i have seen to help with this in other games was Console diablo 3 roll ability, you can actually dodge attacks. And what I haven't seen is some kind of counter magic, there are some shield abilities in this game, but I would love to see something that gives you the feeling that you are blocking, countering, something like that. Maybe even displacement skills? skills that knock back, interrupt, pop up? I am pulling from my MOBA experiance. Just an idea. Of course issue #1 will need to be fixed first because this would just make the issue worse.3) keep up with the item appearance diversity, it used to be bland and you guys have made the appearance of gear more interesting. Thank you for a great game, I hope to see more in the future!

												An excelent dungeon hack and loot game.  Amazing quality for a free game.  Try it out if you like diablo or torchlight.  If you love it, buy some cosmetics or extra bank space to support the developers.Whats different here?Character customization:  When you level you progress through a massive web of upgrades reminiscent of final fantasy x's sphere grid.Special abilites and spells are gained from gems that you socket into your equipment.  The gems gain experience and power up when you have them equiped and can be linked with modifier gems to customize the effects.  Very much like final fantasy vii's materia.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2013
												I recommend this game because I prefer it's free to play model to what is available elsewhere. I've lost items due to deleting a character that shared a stash with other characters. I tried to join a 'Race' event that was not very new player friendly so it was kind of a 2 hour grind. A grind that had me tied to an obligation that turned out to not matter anyways. On a scale of 1 to 10 I'd rate it a 6. Although I like their model for trying to keep microtransactions "ethical", I dislike the fact that it is an arpg that I can not play in single player mode or over a lan. It feels like it should be that type of game even though there was no intention for it to be.It's free, you're getting more than you pay for so to speak.These guys aren't, as of yet (11dec13), using any tactics that compel users to make purchases on the impulse of gaining a small edge. There's no carrot and stick or any unethical use of reinforcement to gain access to players wallets, that alone is why I will likely play this game as long as it is hosted.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 12, 2016
												Path of Exile is a gem in a modern gaming evironment that has decided that the bottom line is worth more than the enjoyment of its players. The Pay to Win or Freemium model works, and has been shown to more profitable than the single payment method. Grinding Gear Games could have taken that path but they didn't. Instead they chose to implement a truely free game where the only thing microtransactions will get you are cool eye candy on your chracter or a pet that follows you around but has no actual effect in battle. Not only that, the devs constantly update and introduce new mechanics into the game ensuring replayablilty and the knowledge that your feedback is actually listened to.Gameplay:Pros: New content every other month from alterations on campaign settings, to new items, to new gameplay options. Solid game performance with minimal to no bugs. For the creatively minded, the game offers endless ways to build characters and classes. And its Free. Actually free.Cons: Most of the gameplay can be grindy in nature and simple quest objectives. Lack of an ingame Player-to-player trading system (which is very problematic because the game has no currency system, only bartering).If you find the pros outweigh the cons, then try out the game!

The game looks, like Diablo, but the whole thing is just different.The biggest difference I've come across, is that you don't just get spells for your class. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
												This game does the free to play system right, and I love the amount of content stuffed into this game. Most free 2 play games are just money grabbers making it unfair to players who don't wanna spend money, well this game does not have any of that pretty much the core game is free and available to all. The perks system is vast and very intimidating when you fist look at, but as time goes on you'll get an idea of what you want and how to get it. One of the deepest systems i have ever seen in an Free 2 play game. I give props to grinding gear games for doing this. The graphics are really good better than most games, yet still runnable on lower end PCs. The graphics are really nice to look at. I really enjoy the world of POE it really immerses you into the world, and each part has different look and feel to it. From the rainy beaches to vast jungles, and to City landscapes it all feels like its own world. The dungeons/Cave really sell it for me, it looks great and every dungeon isnt a copy and paste of another. Yes they have the same or simliar walls, etc, but it feels like its own dungeon at the same time.The gems you find in the game hold different abilities, buffs, that you can equip to your equipment. There are 3 different colors for each gem and each weapon has its slots with the corresponding color. The colors are green, red, and blue. You need certain requirments for your character to have these gems. These gems also hold different abilities for your character that will determine your main aresenal of attack and buffs. Feel free to mix and match. and make your character how you want it to be. I'd say this game is very very very good, and its worth the play if. This might even get new players into a genre of game that they might of never thought they liked. If you're looking for a solid experience and willing to grind countless hours this game is worth the play. To be honest this game should be on your list of top free 2 play games.I would rate this game a solid 9.5/10

content:
Posted: October 24, 2013
												I immediately fell on love with this game! I'll break it down into pros and cons. But the cons really aren't enough to make it not worth playing.==PROS==- First off, it's FREE! And the things in game you do pay for are all aesthetic. So there is no Pay-to-win here.- LOOT!! Loads of loot that is satisfying to find- It looks fantastic! Lot's of gore too- The passive skill tree is amazing- Heaps of nostalgic feelings. If you loved Diablo 2, then play this!- The new potion system is somewhere between classic potions and health globes. But the ability to find "magic" potions makes it fantastic- Skill gems are weird, but it's grown on me- The corpses of monsters staying piled up is gruesome and satisfying==CONS=- Some of the animations are funky. Running looks odd. And there isn't always a lot of oomph to attacking- Can sometimes be lag, where hit's take a second to register (not often though)- I like the removal of gold, but sometimes the bartering system can be super annoying- I wish there were more acheivements. They seem too few and far between

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
												Liked:- Innovative Currency System: The Currency System also plays an integral part in the game's Crafting System- The Skill/Talent System: Very similar to FFX where any class can ultimately play any role, with time/xp, although this was changed in the recent Ascendancy Expansion- Ever changing: With a responsive community and active developers; I've been playing since release and have seen a few Expansions come out, that's not bad for a Free to Play game- Not Pay-to-Win: One of few Free to Play games done right, all in-game purchases are either cosmetic or doesn't affect gameplay as in how much damage you do etc. they are all luxury.- Holds a steady amount of community activities, such as Races or Throwbacks and Leagues where the player can experience the game in different modesDisliked:- The short campaign almost makes it feel a little grindy even in terms of an aRPG- Steep learning curve: There are no real in-game tutorials, so if you're playing your first character, unless you've done your research, it'll almost definitely end in failure- Can be punishing: tied with the previous point, when reaching higher difficulties, if the character you made (let's just say it) sucks, the XP loss penalties will make it impossible to progress in levels.I recommend this game whether playing solo, but it's definately more fun with friends!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												I have played this since 2011, and I cannot recommend it enough. If you liked Diablo 2 and other games like it, I don't think you will be dissapointed with this game, and since its free to play I don't see any reason why you shouldn't at least try it. There is a permanent softcore league, permanent hardcore league. There is a 4 month softcore league, a 4 month hardcore league if you want ladder resets like in D2. And on top of that there are several race leagues daily if you want to compete on a very hardcore level.You are very free in how you want to shape your character. The passive tree is gigantic and you can go anywhere you want on it. The only restriction to the class you choose is where you start on the passive tree. The builds are almost limitless, but if you want to do well in end-game you need to think about what you're doing.This F2P game is actually F2P. There is no P2W or anything like that in this game. The shop consists of almost only cosmetic items. There is ONE thing in the shop that could "help" you or at least make your time go a bit smoother, but again, it is not "NEEDED" to play the game. The item I'm talking about is Stash tabs. Yes, you have an in-game stash much like in D2/D3. The stash consists of 4 tabs, but you can buy as many tabs as you want from the shop. So if you are a hoarder like me, you probably want to buy a lot of tabs.The good thing though, is that the game is go good that I doubt you will think twice about buying some tabs and at the same time give them some support for making this awesome game. They are also expanding the game with content patches, new acts, new gems, items and what not on a regular basis.Again, I can't recommend this game enough, I urge you to at least try the game out if you tend to like these kind of games. HF

Posted: February 14, 2014
												a dungeon crawler like diablo yet so very different. the mechanics of this game are very complex and the versatiliy of each class is very vast. there are so many different ways to build each class the possibilities are endless. how it works is you get all of your abilities through socketing skill gems into your gear. there is no penalty for removing gems from your gear though, all you have to do is right click the gem. the passive skill tree is very large and confusing at first and can be very overwhelming but once you understand the basic mechanics of the game it's fairly easy to understand. the idea is to have your skill gems, passive skills, and support gems all working together in synergy to unlock the full potential of your build and your character's abilities. i recommend for your first character play something tanky or maybe a summoner witch. playing a glass cannon as your first character really is not the best idea.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
												Path of Exile successfully captures the spirit of older action RPGs and updates it for an experience that's as visually appealing as it's fun. The combat itself doesn't differ much from other examples in the genre, but Path of Exile distinguishes itself with a unique ability system based on gems and a labyrinthine passive skill system that permits the creation of almost any type of character. Leaderboards, PvP options, and lootable challenge maps spice up the higher level content, and an unusual bartering system staves off inflation in its multiplayer aspects. Best of all, it's free almost to a fault, revealing a compelling alternative path for free-to-play projects to come.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												Don't let my playtime in steam fool you. I have put well over 4,000 hours into this game and still play it regularly. I just wanted to write this review on steam so I could support the great game with another recommendation for people to play it. Don't let the complicated mechanics overwhelm you. Many of us feel that way when starting, but it's entirely possible to reverse engineer the mechanics and begin making your own builds. In fact, my most recent build was created entirely by me and is the strongest I've played so far.If you are new, I recommend going on the forums and picking a build that seems like it would fit your playstyle. Once you get some items/currency/knowledge as a foundation, then you can begin experimenting with your own flavor of builds and playstyles. The more you do, the easier it becomes.I also recommend the challenge/temporary leagues for new players because of the fresh economy. You will find better prices for gear there overall, and your characters/items/stash will all transfer to the permanent leagues when the temporary ones end. Eventually, you will understand how to start fresh in a new league with no items or characters, but you can still succeed.TLDR: Play the game. Also, search the account "reetismatic" on PoE forums to see how many characters I have made. My Prophecy league character is named Fair.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												Ive been playing before the Steam release. PoE is truly a game i've never been bored of, whether i'm playing with my bf or playing solo. It might be hard to grasp and get into for someone completely new (what isn't though?), but once you get the hang of it and figure things out you become addicted.I have played Diablo II, and Diablo III. I never purchased Diablo III, I could barely play through the trial. I can't fully compare Path of Exile's likeliness and differences to Diablo III; and while it feels like Diablo II, I can't entirely say that because PoE just feels like, well, PoE. It is truly a free to play game, the only things you can buy are cosmetic effects and pets (weapon effects, alternate skill animations, armour glowy effects, footprint effects, etc). The various supporter packs they offer periodically let you purchase physcal merchandise bundled with other in-game goodies, again entirely cosmetic. A player who is serious about collecting and crafting might find that the 4 default stash tabs won't be of much help to them. PoE offers a premium stash tab bundle for about 20 USD, these go a looooong long way. If you've reached the point where you're thinking about crafting and investing then 20 USD is super affordable, especially for free game as well developed as this.  Someone had once said PoE is P2G; Pay to glow. This pretty much sums it up.Aside from that, PoE keeps me entertained with their 4 month challenge leagues. These leagues have their own set of rules and mods. It's always fun completing challenges and planning old builds around new changes, and even new builds entirely. Unique items designed by players and devs alike can drastically change a build for better or worse. With the skill tree being as huge as it is, you never run out of builds to try. You could be a witch and wield a bow, a ranger and wield a wand, it's satisfying planning out your build and reaching the point where it shines. End Game maps are both challenging and rewarding (to me at least, others will disagree ;) ) Path of Exile's frequent updates, whether they be bug fixes or new content, are always welcomed. I love seeing a game maintained and updated as well as PoE is.The Devs and staff take part in the community; they don't put out messages/updates and forget about their players. My personal experiences have been nothing but postive. Path of Exile is known for its desync problems. I've had my share of issues, especially while on hardcore servers. You can almost always tell when you are desynced. Some builds desync more than others too unfortunately, so if you are one of those people that likes to play hardcore only modes, PoE might not be for you. A simple /oos command fixes any sync issues, and if you can learn to play around the desync then it really is an enjoyable game. That is maybe the only downside to an otherwise outstanding game.As others have said, the game is completely free, so why not check it out? Whatever you decide, happy gaming! :)

Posted: February 9, 2014
												Very deep game with tons of customization. The graphics are passable but it wont earn any major awards with its weapon and armor designs. The overall theme is dark and gritty with decent amount of varied location. The game world isnt as big as some other arpg but the developers placed majors focus on the end game where you can explore randomized dungeons. The replaybility of this game is very depend on experimental with characters as well as the laddering system. The class and skill system is very refreshing but also daunting. Random builds with no focus will struggle mightly, as the game is pretty unforgiving to novices. If someone wants a jack of all demigod, that person will be in for disappointment. This game rewards planning and adaption, rather than face rolling every enemy that comes towards you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												This is what Diablo III should have been (at least in my opinion). It follows the tried and tested gameplay formula of this genre with an interesting character development system.Skills are based on gems that are found throughout the game.These need to be socketed into items to be used and these level up with you as long as they are socketed. In theory any class can use any skill (although skill level is limited by the appropriate stat). In addition to this there is a large passive skill matrix which is similar in style to the skill development in Final Fantasy 10 (If any of you remember that one). For those who don't, all character classes start at different places on the matrix and (in theory) can access any skill, although some skills are much easier to reach for certain classes. This means that character development is much more freeform than it is in a lot of other games of this type. I've only played three classes to level 20 or so so I don't know how the game holds up in the final stages, but it seems like an enjoyable, nicely put together game so far. It has PVP (which I haven't tried), regular events and (apparantly) a sizeable number of players. If you find yourself at a loose end one day and fancy taking a chance on an indie game, I'd recommend giving this one a try. Its free to play and as far as I can tell not pay to win, so what have you got to loose :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												This game is a must try. CAUTION: May Contain Spoilers.Pros:Path of Exile starts out at a very easy entry level difficulty, and progressively, gets more difficult.Unlockable content.Diversity of play. From spells/animations, to your skill tree. 3G gives you such a feeling of "Choice" in how your character functions that even if you feel some portion of the game is unenjoyable, you can move on to a different area, and still enjoy the decisions you have made for your Champion through gameplay.Grinding. Now equipment grinding isn't necessarily the most enjoyable thing by itself, but they have managed to make their random map system, and the entire concept of the items that make the game, ease the torment of it.Community. Thus far the community in this game is nothing but welcoming to everyone as far as I've seen.Equipment customization. Unfortunately you can't customize the way it looks(Because some pants would be nice). You are an exile so, point made 3G. What you can do however, is customize everything else (Sockets, Links, Rarity) to certain extents. They managed to give players what they WANT to do while making it a fun Risk Vs. Reward environment.Inventory Space. You start with a decent amount of inventory space. Its not a D3 inventory, but it isn't a D1 inventory either. You can purchase more tabs (not certain the limit) to increase your inventory space. I didn't actually purchase inventory space (of which I purchased 10-15 more tabs) to even pack rat it up, rather just to organize!There are more pros to this game I'm not throwing on the table, but I could go on. Now to some cons.Cons:Making a mistake in developing your character the way you want to, especially if you don't catch it early on, can be an arduous repair. Some may even consider simply remaking their character.Progression. No matter how you build your character (if it's your first character), you will eventually run into a brick wall. Around mid 40's as a Witch, after already pushing my limits, I came to a point where I could no longer progress by myself. This prompted the grind for equipment, but as I found it is actually to grind for the items used as currency to trade for equipment I'd like to have, rather than grinding for equipment I could consider an upgrade.Grouping. I only follow Progression on this to identify, sure, you could group up to push even further, but like every other MMORPG you play, you'll find its hard to maintain a solid group to continue through your quest line without already having close friends to play with you. The grouping system is average at best, comparing to other MMO's I have experienced, but it accomplishes the basic task, without any major flaws. With the game developing, and the player base growing, I'm sure Grouping will eventually trade places with Community, as trends point to this, to no fault of 3G.To Be Determined:The Store. Its a little clunky, and is very limited in what you can purchase, but by no means is pay to win, nor does it stab you with 20 dollar micro-transactions. Most of the things you can purchase are cosmetic, with a few equipment cosmetics, and a few spell cosmetics. As a Guild Leader/Officer, you can also purchase bank tabs to increase space for the pack rats. The store itself, I found a little difficult to find, when I finally realized it existed. I think part of being successful in the F2P gaming industry, where you do make money should atleast be obvious to any potential buyer.Summation: This game is deffinately a must try. You'll feel immersion almost instantly, with few references you wont immediately understand, or already have defined to you. The depth of choice you have in all aspects of your character, skills, and equipment, will leave you reaping what you have sewn, or starting anew to experience another play style with a different character. The progression of difficulty is deffinately something to get used to, and hopefully it stays the way it is, because sometimes difficulty is what will have you honing your abilities to push yourself even further.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												There is something really enjoyable about jumping fists first into a group of enemies and punching them so hard they explode.Path of Exile is a really fun and addictive game, and the never ending hunt for better loot will have you come back again and again. Any person who likes rpg's will like this one, no doubt about that.BUT, this game is definitely not without its flaws, and some rather frustrating ones at that. If you do not have a decent internet connection (and sometimes even if you do), you will suffer from some very bad desyncs, witch will lead to some very frustrating deaths. Suddenly teleporting into the group of enemies you try to run away from and hitting on enemies that isn't there, is just something you have to get used to.Now, if you can live with all the flaws and keep yourself from ragequitting, there is a huge amount of fun to be had in this game.Hopefully the flaws will be sorted out in the future, and maybe a better trading system will be implemented?.. but even if not, this is still a must try for any rpg fan, and since it is absolutely free, there is no reason not to!.. You are basically getting a 30+ $ game for nothing. Also there is no aspect of pay to win/progress faster or anything like that. The only way to give GGG some money is through cosmetics for your characters.So I give it a big thumbs up despite the frustrations this game can give you, and I will recommend Path of Exile to anyone.

												ENGLISH or my best at it...i really like this game but it has some issues with the performance some times it get stuck at loading screen(solved readin a few guides for better perfomance, and totally solved when i upgraded my dead video card it seems that is a cooler is not working the card might die XD) and it is an issue with the race events they make since those are timed events beyond that the game looks and  plays awesome...to some people the pasive skill tree is a down but for those i just say dont try to play it as some other games where you need to get all lower points before advancing  in this tree you need to foresee what do you want and wich is the easiest and shortest way to it since every point is a level ...i must say that i should not recomend this unless you have no other addictions XD ESPAÑOLrealmente me gusto este juego, tuve problemas de rendimiento que al mejorar el equipo dejaron de ser unproblema ademas de revisar algunas guias para mejorar el rendimiento cuando no actualizaba la pc, al mejorar la tarjeta de video todo se resolvio, solo tengo un problema con las carreras por que son eventos con tiempo y si tienes periodos de carga muy largos pues no son para ti, los eventos de liga son muy buenos si ya tienes control sobre como subir de nivel,...para algunas persona el arbol de habilidades es una desventaja, pero solo dire no jueguen PAth of Exile como un ARPG clasico donde maximisas cada habilidad de bajo nivel para iniciar con las de mayor rango aqui esto es una especie de mapa  donde tienes que pkanififcar a donde quieres llegar y planear la ruta mas corta ya que cada punto es un nivel...no deberia reomendar este juego a menos que no tengas niguna otra adicción XD, aunque de lo positivo es que es muy bueno pero puedes dejarlo sin problemas y regresar luego y seguir divirtiendote...

content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
												POE is the deepest aRPG slasher ever made. It uses some tested ideas while introducing highly innovative systems and end-game mechanics. To put it straight Path of Exile is AAA+ game FREE of charge. No pay to win. Grind to win! The game is quite polished already future announcements make you connected to Wreaclast even more. Devs give their best, the rapport is great and from what i've seen in the past year there were 25+ patches, constant tweaking with the mechanics, skill tree* and skills. Dedication is the way Grinding Gear works. The way they introduce changes clearly shows how they care. *The sheer size of the skill tree is a guarantee jaw drop if seen for the first time

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
												Liked:- Innovative Currency System: The Currency System also plays an integral part in the game's Crafting System- The Skill/Talent System: Very similar to FFX where any class can ultimately play any role, with time/xp, although this was changed in the recent Ascendancy Expansion- Ever changing: With a responsive community and active developers; I've been playing since release and have seen a few Expansions come out, that's not bad for a Free to Play game- Not Pay-to-Win: One of few Free to Play games done right, all in-game purchases are either cosmetic or doesn't affect gameplay as in how much damage you do etc. they are all luxury.- Holds a steady amount of community activities, such as Races or Throwbacks and Leagues where the player can experience the game in different modesDisliked:- The short campaign almost makes it feel a little grindy even in terms of an aRPG- Steep learning curve: There are no real in-game tutorials, so if you're playing your first character, unless you've done your research, it'll almost definitely end in failure- Can be punishing: tied with the previous point, when reaching higher difficulties, if the character you made (let's just say it) sucks, the XP loss penalties will make it impossible to progress in levels.I recommend this game whether playing solo, but it's definately more fun with friends!
